column4: Hello. I can't get a connection to the Internet with my Ubuntu machine. It attempts to connect and fails, but it works normally on Windows. Its a wired connection. It has worked before.
I could try, but I would have to unplug here to try there... Is there anything else I should do?
thats all we need, if it pings then your DNS sucks
Back. It does not ping. Tá¸§e error message is ''connect: Network unreachable''
then you are not getting an IP address. Are the lights on the interface flashing ok? and showing link light on the router?
All lights are flashing. As I said, it is working flawlessly in Windows...
ok then i'd websearch for your wired chip to find guides and/or bug reports
But it has worked absolutely fine for months. Yesterday I was upgrading to 10.10 and this happened.
yes, you now have a different kernel with different drivers
so you need to take some action
No, sir. I couldnt complete the upgrade due to this problem...
you may need to compile a driver,or download a package. you can even use ndiswrapper for it
How am I going to do that whithout a connection?
